page.title: 11 FARMING
page.content: The area covered in our survey is mostly farmland. There are four main farms surrounding Vernham Dean,of which the largest is managed for the owner, Mr. Govett, by Mr. Johnson. The farm at Linkenholt is also managed for a trust. The other two farms are farmed by their owners, Mr Richard Mills and Mr John Herriot. The land is predominantly arable, crops being winter barley, wheat and peas. Where the land becomes steep on the edge of chalk downland, grass is grazed by sheep. On the lower , more level pastures there is intensive dairying and silage is made for winter feeding. None of the produce is used locally except for a small acreage of wheat grown for local thatching, the grain is used for stock feed..
